trans-unit.source: The Azure Toolkit for Eclipse requires the following software components:
trans-unit.target: The Azure Toolkit for Eclipse requires the following software components:

trans-unit.source: Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers, Indigo or later.
trans-unit.target: Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers, Indigo or later.

trans-unit.source: A Java Developer Kit (JDK), v1.7 or later.
trans-unit.target: A Java Developer Kit (JDK), v1.7 or later.

trans-unit.source: Operating Systems - the Azure Toolkit for Eclipse has been tested on the following operating systems:
trans-unit.target: Operating Systems - the Azure Toolkit for Eclipse has been tested on the following operating systems:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 and 2012 R2, Windows Server 2008 and 2008 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 and 2012 R2, Windows Server 2008 and 2008 R2

trans-unit.source: More information can be found on the [Azure Toolkit for Eclipse](http://marketplace.eclipse.org/content/azure-toolkit-eclipse) page at the Eclipse Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: More information can be found on the [Azure Toolkit for Eclipse](http://marketplace.eclipse.org/content/azure-toolkit-eclipse) page at the Eclipse Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you are using the Azure Toolkit for Eclipse on Windows, the toolkit requires installing the Azure SDK 2.7 or later.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you are using the Azure Toolkit for Eclipse on Windows, the toolkit requires installing the Azure SDK 2.7 or later.

trans-unit.source: You have two options for installing the Azure SDK:
trans-unit.target: You have two options for installing the Azure SDK:

trans-unit.source: You can download and install the Azure SDK by using the [Web Platform Installer (WebPI)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=252838).
trans-unit.target: You can download and install the Azure SDK by using the [Web Platform Installer (WebPI)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=252838).

trans-unit.source: If you do not have the Azure SDK installed when you create your first Azure deployment project, you will be prompted to automatically download install the requisite version of the Azure SDK.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have the Azure SDK installed when you create your first Azure deployment project, you will be prompted to automatically download install the requisite version of the Azure SDK.

trans-unit.source: Note that the Azure SDK is only required on Windows.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Azure SDK is only required on Windows.
